# Opportunity Notice: Design-Builder Services for Transition Centre Construction
### Overview:
The Government of Canada's Department of National Defence (DND) invites interested Modified-Design-Builders to submit their interest in providing Design-Builder services for the construction of a Transition Centre in Edmonton, Alberta. This Advance Procurement Notice (APN) is not a bid solicitation, but rather an opportunity for interested parties to begin the sponsorship request process for obtaining the required security clearance(s).

### Background:
The proposed Transition Centre will support all Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) members, regular and reserve forces, in Alberta. The project will deliver new infrastructure to accommodate the CAF Transition Group (TG) organization at 3 CDSB Edmonton in one centralized location. The project aims to provide approximately 72 personnel with an estimated total gross floor area of 1,912 m2.

### Scope of Work:
The intended scope of work includes:

* Construction of a new building with an estimated gross area of 1,912 m2 to accommodate the Transition Centre located at 3 CDSB Edmonton and the CAF Transition Unit (TU) AB-North headquarters staff.
* Development of an exterior area of approximately 3,109 m2 to accommodate 62 civilian vehicles and exterior storage for tools and equipment.
* Design and certification to LEED Silver and CaGBC Zero Carbon Building – Design V3 standard.
* Implementation, including construction, commissioning, and all CaGBC certifications of the facility.

### Security Clearance:
To be eligible for contract award, Modified-Design-Builders must hold all required security clearance(s) at the time of closing. The required security clearance(s) are anticipated to be:

* Valid and active DESIGNATED ORGANIZATION SCREENING (DOS) granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC)

### Sponsorship Process:
Defence Construction Canada (DCC) provides a sponsorship process for Modified-Design-Builders to obtain the required security clearance(s). To begin the sponsorship process, interested parties must submit a sponsorship request application to DCC through their website.
